quotes.quote: What's Life without a little risk?
quotes.author: Sirius Black

quotes.text: Not all those who wander are lost.
quotes.author: J.R.R. Tolkien

quotes.quote: Batter my heart, three-person'd God,
quotes.author: John Donne

quotes.quote: Most people are, Scout, when you finally see them.
quotes.author: Atticus Finch

quotes.quote: Now I am become death, the destroyer of Worlds.
quotes.author: Krishn

quotes.quote: No real change in history has ever been achieved by discussions.
quotes.author: Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose

quotes.quote: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
quotes.author: Winston Churchill

quotes.quote: In the end, we will remember not the words of our enemies, but the silence of our friends.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.quote: The only thing we have to fear is fear itself.
quotes.author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quotes.quote: Imagination is more important than knowledge.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
quotes.author: Lao Tzu

quotes.quote: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: Be the change that you wish to see in the world.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: The best way to predict the future is to create it.
quotes.author: Peter Drucker

quotes.quote: Do not go where the path may lead, go instead where there is no path and leave a trail.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: The mind acts like an enemy for those who do not control it.
quotes.author: Shree Krishna

quotes.quote: Arise, awake, and stop not till the goal is reached.
quotes.author: Swami Vivekananda

quotes.quote: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment.
quotes.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quotes.quote: I think, therefore I am.
quotes.author: René Descartes

quotes.quote: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
quotes.author: Mahatma Gandhi

quotes.quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: It is not in the stars to hold our destiny but in ourselves.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: All the world's a stage, and all the men and women merely players.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: I have no special talent. I am only passionately curious.
quotes.author: Albert Einstein

quotes.quote: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
quotes.author: Mae West

quotes.quote: You have the right to perform your prescribed duties, but you are not entitled to the fruits of your actions.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.quote: The soul is neither born, and nor does it die; it is eternal and indestructible.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.quote: A person is said to have attained yoga, the union with the Divine, when, having renounced all desires, he is satisfied in the self by the self.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.quote: Perform your duty equipoised, O Arjuna, abandoning all attachment to success or failure. Such equanimity is called yoga.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.quote: In the middle of difficulty lies opportunity.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.quote: When meditation is mastered, the mind is unwavering like the flame of a lamp in a windless place.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.quote: He who is not disturbed by the dualities of happiness and distress, and is unbothered by the material world, is certainly eligible for liberation.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.quote: The mind is everything. What you think, you become.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.quote: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
quotes.author: Dalai Lama

quotes.quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: To love and be loved is to feel the sun from both sides.
quotes.author: David Viscott
quotes.source: Finding Your Strength in Difficult Times

quotes.quote: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
quotes.author: Confucius

quotes.quote: The best among you is the one who doesn’t harm others with his tongue and hands.
quotes.author: Prophet Muhammad

quotes.quote: Do not dwell in the past, do not dream of the future, concentrate the mind on the present moment.
quotes.author: Buddha

quotes.quote: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
quotes.author: Steve Jobs

quotes.quote: I have a dream that one day this nation will rise up and live out the true meaning of its creed: 'We hold these truths to be self-evident, that all men are created equal.'
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.quote: Two roads diverged in a wood, and I—I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference.
quotes.author: Robert Frost

quotes.quote: Ask not what your country can do for you – ask what you can do for your country.
quotes.author: John F. Kennedy

quotes.quote: I think, therefore I am.
quotes.author: René Descartes

quotes.quote: The greatest glory in living lies not in never falling, but in rising every time we fall.
quotes.author: Nelson Mandela

quotes.quote: Life is what happens to you while you're busy making other plans.
quotes.author: John Lennon

quotes.quote: Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that.
quotes.author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quotes.quote: The future belongs to those who believe in the beauty of their dreams.
quotes.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quotes.quote: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
quotes.author: Thomas A. Edison
quotes.source: As quoted in Thomas Alva Edison: Sixty Years of an Inventor's Life, 1908

quotes.quote: To be or not to be, that is the question.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
quotes.author: Edmund Burke

quotes.quote: I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it.
quotes.author: Evelyn Beatrice Hall

quotes.quote: The greatest wealth is to live content with little.
quotes.author: Plato

quotes.quote: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: The secret of happiness is freedom, the secret of freedom is courage.
quotes.author: Thucydides

quotes.quote: Man is by nature a political animal.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: I think therefore I am.
quotes.author: René Descartes

quotes.quote: He who has a why to live can bear almost any how.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: God is dead. God remains dead. And we have killed him.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: I think, therefore I am.
quotes.author: René Descartes

quotes.quote: One cannot step twice in the same river.
quotes.author: Heraclitus
quotes.source: As quoted by Plato in Cratylus

quotes.quote: The life of man [is] solitary, poor, nasty, brutish, and short.
quotes.author: Thomas Hobbes

quotes.quote: I know that I know nothing.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: To be is to be perceived.
quotes.author: George Berkeley
quotes.source: A Treatise Concerning the Principles of Human Knowledge, 1710

quotes.quote: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
quotes.author: Will Durant
quotes.source: The Story of Philosophy, 1926 (often misattributed to Aristotle)

quotes.quote: The unexamined life is not worth living.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: I can control my passions and emotions if I can understand their nature.
quotes.author: Spinoza

quotes.quote: Happiness is the highest good.
quotes.author: Aristotle

quotes.quote: There is only one good, knowledge, and one evil, ignorance.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: The function of prayer is not to influence God, but rather to change the nature of the one who prays.
quotes.author: Søren Kierkegaard
quotes.source: Purity of Heart Is to Will One Thing, 1847

quotes.quote: Man is condemned to be free.
quotes.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quotes.quote: One cannot conceive anything so strange and so implausible that it has not already been said by one philosopher or another.
quotes.author: René Descartes

quotes.quote: There is but one truly serious philosophical problem, and that is suicide.
quotes.author: Albert Camus

quotes.quote: The owl of Minerva spreads its wings only with the falling of the dusk.
quotes.author: G.W.F. Hegel

quotes.quote: Entities should not be multiplied unnecessarily.
quotes.author: William of Ockham
quotes.source: Attributed, principle known as Occam's Razor

quotes.quote: The limits of my language mean the limits of my world.
quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.quote: I am the wisest man alive, for I know one thing, and that is that I know nothing.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: The greatest happiness of the greatest number is the foundation of morals and legislation.
quotes.author: Jeremy Bentham

quotes.quote: Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent.
quotes.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

quotes.quote: The mind is furnished with ideas by experience alone.
quotes.author: John Locke

quotes.quote: To be is to do.
quotes.author: Immanuel Kant

quotes.quote: Cogito, ergo sum. (I think, therefore I am.)
quotes.author: René Descartes

quotes.quote: There is no such thing as society: there are individual men and women, and there are families.
quotes.author: Margaret Thatcher

quotes.quote: The philosophers have only interpreted the world, in various ways. The point, however, is to change it.
quotes.author: Karl Marx

quotes.quote: What does not destroy me, makes me stronger.
quotes.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quotes.quote: I am not what happened to me, I am what I choose to become.
quotes.author: Carl Jung

quotes.quote: We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful about what we pretend to be.
quotes.author: Kurt Vonnegut

quotes.quote: The wise man should restrain his senses like the crane and accomplish his purpose with due knowledge of his place, time and ability.
quotes.author: Chanakya

quotes.quote: The world is the great gymnasium where we come to make ourselves strong.
quotes.author: Swami Vivekananda

quotes.quote: Detachment is not that you should own nothing, but that nothing should own you.
quotes.author: Ali ibn Abi Talib

quotes.quote: The goal of life is to make your heartbeat match the beat of the universe, to match your nature with Nature.
quotes.author: Joseph Campbell

quotes.quote: You have a right to perform your prescribed duties, but you are not entitled to the fruits of your actions.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.quote: The self is the friend of a man who masters himself through the self, but for a man without self-mastery, the self is like an enemy at war.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.quote: One who sees inaction in action, and action in inaction, is intelligent among men.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.quote: There is nothing noble in being superior to your fellow man; true nobility is being superior to your former self.
quotes.author: Ernest Hemingway

quotes.quote: The wise grieve neither for the living nor for the dead.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.quote: Karmanye vadhikaraste Ma Phaleshu Kadachana, Ma Karmaphalaheturbhurma Te Sangostvakarmani.
quotes.author: Lord Krishna

quotes.quote: The mind is restless and difficult to restrain, but it is subdued by practice.
quotes.author: Patanjali

quotes.quote: Undisturbed calmness of mind is attained by cultivating friendliness toward the happy, compassion for the unhappy, delight in the virtuous, and indifference toward the wicked.
quotes.author: Patanjali

quotes.quote: When you are inspired by some great purpose, some extraordinary project, all your thoughts break their bonds.
quotes.author: Patanjali

quotes.quote: Comfort is no test of truth. Truth is often far from being comfortable.
quotes.author: Swami Vivekananda
